abstract_summ: To address planetary health threats that cross international borders, such as COVID-19, societies must practice interdependence sovereignty and direct resources to organizations that facilitate shared global governance, and thus can enable us to adapt and ultimately build a more resilient world.Conclusions Locally implementable interventions which rapidly build WASH and health system capacity are required across Syria to ensure early detection and management of COVID-19 cases.[Image: see text]The COVID-19 pandemic highlights the multidimensional and inseparable connection between human health and environmental systems.Abstract The emergence of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) in China at December 2019 had led to a global outbreak of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the disease started to spread all over the world and became an international public health issue.There is need for a coordinated public-private sector partnership in the recovery plan of each country, taking into account their contextual and country specific health system and economy, but not discarding the universal application thereof.
title_summ: Coronavirus 2019 and health systems affected by protracted conflict: the case of SyriaCOVID-19: A Call for Physical Scientists and EngineersRestructured society and environment: A review on potential technological strategies to control the COVID-19 pandemicAn introduction to economic studies, health emergencies, and COVID‐19Global assessment of environment, health and economic impact of the novel coronavirus (COVID-19)Novel Coronavirus Disease: A delicate balancing act between health and the economyNo more business as usual: agile and effective responses to emerging pathogen threats require open data and open analyticsInvolvement of the open-source community in combating the worldwide COVID-19 pandemic: a review.The power of disconnection during the COVID-19 emergency: From isolation to reparation.Post-Coronavirus Disease 2019 Health Care and University: From Efficiency to Resilience.COVID-19: A Matter of Planetary, not Only National Health.
title_abstract_phrases: To address planetary health threats that cross international borders, such as COVID-19, societies must practice interdependence sovereignty and direct resources to organizations that facilitate shared global governance, and thus can enable us to adapt and ultimately build a more resilient world.Novel Coronavirus Disease: A delicate balancing act between health and the economyThe emergence of the deadly novel Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) has resuscitated global attention on the state of health governance and well-being of citizens.Conclusions Locally implementable interventions which rapidly build WASH and health system capacity are required across Syria to ensure early detection and management of COVID-19 cases.The COVID-19 pandemic highlights the multidimensional and inseparable connection between human health and environmental systems.Restructured society and environment: A review on potential technological strategies to control the COVID-19 pandemicAbstract The emergence of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) in China at December 2019 had led to a global outbreak of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and the disease started to spread all over the world and became an international public health issue.
